Content: [dscrdvrsc] <thedawson13> Hey guys I stumbled upon this project due to a low key shill on Twitter. I'm wondering how veruspay works exactly when veruscoin has such low liquidity? Or is veruspay just a gateway by which you can use other currencies? I'm confused

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Oink> @thedawson13 Veruspay is a brand new plug-in, which is developing continuously. Veruspay currently supports Veruscoin and Pirates payments, but the development continues. The plug-in connects to the coins chain using it‚Äôs own wallets and is therefore independent, just like any full wallet on the coins network.
The liquidity you are referring to is due to the fact that this project was launched without an Initial Coin Offering or pre-mining.
I hope this answers your questions, but if you want to know more, don‚Äôt hesitate.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @jintaa two things... first, PBaaS is actually going to drive redistribution, as it will be used for creating other chains and cause existing Verus to get recycled to miners and stakers through use of PBaaS. that will hopefully make 24 coins a smaller and smaller part of why people mine through a sustainable economy. second, i need to run to eat dinner, but I can come back to discuss more a bit later. Here's a current snapshot of the API description for defining a PBaaS chain:

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <miketout> ```c
            "definechain '{\"name\": \"BAAS\", ... }'\n"
            "\n\n"

            "\nArguments\n"
            "      {\n"
            "         \"name\"       : \"xxxx\",    (string, required) unique Verus ecosystem-wide name/symbol of this PBaaS chain\n"
            "         \"address\"    : \"Rxxx\",    (string, optional) premine and launch fee recipient\n"
            "         \"premine\"    : \"n\",       (int,    optional) amount of coins that will be premined and distributed to premine address\n"
            "         \"convertible\" : \"n\",      (int,    optional) amount of coins that may be converted from Verus, price determined by total contribution\n"
            "         \"launchfee\"  : \"n\",       (int,    optional) VRSC fee for conversion at startup, multiplied by amount, divided by 100000000\n"
            "         \"afterblock\" : \"n\",       (int,    optional) VRSC block must be notarized into block 1 of PBaaS chain, default curheight + 100\n"
            "         \"eras\"       : \"n\",       (int,    optional) number of eras in this chain's life\n"
```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Patrick Crypto> @miketout could you give a quick response on why you feel so strongly about pbaas? I am curious what in your mind differentiates it from something like Ardor?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> Interesting question. They're really not the same thing. though there could be some overlap in larger projects. In fact, each of the PBaaS chains are not exactly children, and are actually started with transactions that make offers to the entire Verus community of miners and Verus owners to participate in, mine, and support their projects and applications through a scalable, decentralized cross-chain protocol. This will enable even transiently created and abandoned blockchains to operate on behalf of applications, or long term projects to start up with easy configuration and a scalable future, without requiring any immediate development or alternate infrastructure provisioning on the part of the person, organization, or application creating the blockchain for its use. PBaaS chains could even be fairly launched, expected to stay coupled to Verus or another Verus chain as part of a project or application, or even launched and separated at a later date. They can also have pre-mines, funding/conversion periods, and will be able to earn their own native rewards, Verus, or a combination of the two. All chains will be automatically merge-mineable, have support for 51% hash attack protection, cross chain transactions, and all basic features of Verus, as well as the ability to develop smart transactions to support applications.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> Also, I should mention. The PBaaS upgrade will include a unique (to my knowledge) PoS proof in the header itself that enables a header to be much more trusted than on other PoS enabled chains, and is part of what makes the automated cross-chain system more secure as well. As far as I know, there is not another PoS system with such a header proof of the stake that won the block.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Patrick Crypto> Is there any impact to staking with merge mining? Or is it strictly mining related

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> merge mining of other chains can earn rewards from the other chains. staking on other chains can earn rewards on the other chains. mining and staking on either the other chains or Verus can earn cross chain notarization rewards.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> and of course, some chains will have systems that enable transactions intended to capture value or information and exchange value

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> I also expect some PBaaS chains to provide opportunity to participate in the chain by using Verus, which would enable Verus holders to earn by staking.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <apjh> Hi dear community and developers. I have one suggestion with the tipbot and staking.

I am also a member of another community where I see they run a similar tipbot that we have here. I also just see that the tipbot they use has a staking feature that I would like to have we had the opportunity here too.

I have now mined verus the last 3 months and have mined about 150 coins at that period, which I am very happy with as I only mine on a single pc that mostly only mining for 10 hours a day.

I have staked my coins ever since the start but have not yet received any staking reward, this may be because the pc must have a restart once in a while and i have so few coins still.

Such a function in the tipbot could result in smaller miners such myself being able to place coins in a staking pool to get faster reward.

I thought this might have been a good idea for this community as well?
sorry if i post this in wrong channel, i was trying to find a suitable place to post this.

Author: gzezo#2697
Content: HI guys, what algorithm is Versus I would like to get my hands on some, and wondered if it might be profitable to mine with GPU ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> VerusHash 2.0. Its their own algo designed to better balance hashrate across hardware types. CPUs tend to do the best and now FPGAs are doing well too. GPUs appear to be less efficient at the algo at this time but some are running both CPU and GPU together to get a decent hash

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> @Matterbridge

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> Plus you can check out the CPU hashrate and GPU hashrate channel to get an idea of what other people are getting

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <dakgnosis> @miketout Regarding the ability for any Verus autochain to develop smart contracts, will we be able to interact with them using z addresses? I could see huge benefits in providing anonymity with a smart contract, especially for businesses that may not want to reveal their finances.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @dakgnosis smart transactions can interact with z-transactions, but it's a matter of being able to spend from and to smart transactions from z-transactions, which can be done.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> for example, the stake guard smart transaction allows anyone who can prove double staking to spend the output to a z-address already. the proof of double staking is there, but no-one can see where the spend went
